hymn.title: Along the shores of Galilee

layout.singingstanza: A -- long the shores of Gal -- i -- lee, When Christ five thou -- sand fed, Not one was o -- mit -- ted In the break -- ing of the bread. To -- day they die in heath -- en lands, They die in want and dread, For they have been o -- mit -- ted In the break -- ing of the Bread. Lord, I would give them the Bread of Life, The Liv -- ing Wa -- ter too; My heart cries out, "Oh, here am I, Rea -- dy, Thy will to do."

hymn.copyright: Copyright 1944 by Singspiration, Inc. All Rights Reserved. Used by permission.

lyrics.stanza: Along the shores of Galilee, When Christ five thousand fed, Not one was omitted In the breaking of the bread. Today they die in heathen lands, They die in want and dread, For they have been omitted In the breaking of the Bread.
Lord, I would give them the Bread of Life, The Living Water too; My heart cries out, "Oh, here am I, Ready, Thy will to do."

Long years have passed and few have heard That Jesus Christ has bled, That they might feed on Him who died To be that Living Bread. To gods of stone and wood they cry, Yet they are never fed, For they have been omitted In the breaking of the Bread.

Great God, who gave Thine only Son, Help us, now Spirit-led, To tell the story of Thy love To those who ask for bread. Then gladly will we go or send, Till this blest news has spread, And they have been included In the breaking of the Bread.
